page.title: 01GAZETTEER.
page.content: Our area covers the NW and mid-central section of Corby, with Rockingham Estate farmland to the West, and Cottingham village. The urban area is post-war (1945) Council housing, built when Corby was a booming steel town 1933-7. Over half the population is Scottish (Glaswegian). Closure of quarries and iron-steel making plants made 7000 of the 12000 work force redundant (Tube Works now import steel strip). Council plus Government/EEC grants created new industrial areas reducing 24% unemployment to 18%. Rural Northants considers Corby socially and culturally down-market, for this 2nd biggest town still carries its early, but not now deserved, rough working- class image. It is a town slowly changing its image. Its people are friendly and proud of Corby.
